before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"de3p4","text":"Ensure all consumables are in stock and all compounds and reagents are freshly prepared","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fcauh","text":"Create a result file in MultiQuant 3.0.3 by opening the software, selecting an LC-MS/MS data file acquired in Analyst software, that has been acquired following extraction using a protocol with carefully designed calibration curve and known calibration units. Select some or all of the samples in the batch of the file, selecting the processing method (as above) and allow the software to evaluate the data, before defining calibration ranges and assessing integration of peaks. To do this, follow these steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7j929","text":"In MultiQuant in the batch of samples define sample type - Blanks, Double Blanks, Standards, QCs and Unknowns (samples) and Solvents. Add known amounts to standards and QCs according to the Etraction protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1cgdt","text":"Insert standard curve values and QC values in 'actual amount' column, according to the calibration table and QC table. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ls9l","text":"Check all peaks have integrated and that there are peak areas for each analyte - reassign retention time if it is not quite picking the peak and use Metric plots to assess peak area and retention time to ensure correct peaks have been integrated","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"6mx2l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E7A0327C345711EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":240,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"6o0fl\",\"text\":\"Metric plot selected along with Calibration curve and identified peak.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_7373.jpeg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ypbm8pf.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ymbm8pf.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ynbm8pf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/m8ykbm8pf.webp","width":320}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eradm","text":"Check calibration curves for accuracy (\u003c20%) and exclude those points that are outwith. Ensure there are a minmum of 6 points in each calibration curve and that they have a regression coefficient R\u003e0.99","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1f9kk","text":"On the 'Raw Data' tab select 'filter' in the top menu of Excle and select the first analyte in the list (alphabetical). Copy this analyte excel data into the new tab and rename the tab with the analyte name. Repeat with all analytes until you have an excel spreadsheet with the following tabs - Raw Data; Analyte 1; Analyte 2, etcâ€¦.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ae2v","text":"In each of the separate tabs for the analytes - go into the tabs and rename the 'calculated amount' column on the Analyte tab to '[Analyte name] ng' and rename in the 2nd Analyte tab to '[2nd Analyte name] ng' (use the real analyte name!)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f3tr9","text":"Create a new tab and name it 'Summary'. Copy the first three columns from the first Analyte tab, which contains sample details and calibration level details. Paste into the new tab. Then return to the Analyte tab and copy the '[Analyte name] ng' column. Repeat this copying of the [Analyte name] ng column until all analytes in the MultiQaunt file and hence the excel file, have been copied. This results in a Summary table that is the major results of the analysis in terms of concentration","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dij6v","text":"Select a data file (*.wiff) of a batch of data that includes calibration standards and unknowns, collected in Analyst and select all samples and standards or a selection. Click Next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fmm9n","text":"Select the processing method created in MultiQuant that is appropriate to the data file (MultiQuant quantitation method file). Click Next.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Using MultiQuant to evaluate Analyst acquired LC-MS/MS data
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9mkk7","text":"Save the file (a result file) with the file naming convention of the data file (yyymmdd_Exxxx_Analyte_initials) before beginning to process the data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3rri1","text":"Copy the alphanumeric data of all peak areas and calculated amounts from MultiQuant result file into Microsoft Excel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"alut9","text":"Open Microsoft Excel and create a new spreadsheet and name it using the same file naming convention as used for the MultiQuant result file and name the first tab â€˜Raw Dataâ€™","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9165c","text":"If the calibration curve units are ng and the sample extracted has been a volume, add a column ahead of all Analyte concentrations, include the volume extracted for each sample and then use this column to calculate the ng/mL amount by dividing the â€˜calculated amountâ€™ by the volume (uL) and multiply by 1000 to give the ng/mL amount of each analyte. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ilmh","text":"If the calibration curve units are ng and the sample extracted has been a mass of tissue, add a column ahead of all Analyte concentrations, include the volume extracted for each sample and then use this column to calculate the ng/g. amount by dividing the â€˜calculated amountâ€™ by the mass in g to give the ng/g amount of each analyte","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Transferring MultiQuant alphanumeric data into Excel to summarise results
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bi4bb","text":"If the sample analysed was urine, it is necessary to correct the amount of analyte detected by the creatinine concentration (measured elsewhere) OR if the 24 hour volume of urine is known this can be used to express the amount of analyte/day by calculating as a ratio of the extracted volume/day volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

85393.section: Create a processing method in MultiQuant using an acquired data file
85393.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eoh0","text":"Using a data file created in Analyst, with known analyte mass transitions and retention times, build a Processing method that integrates peaks with sufficient time window to integrate the peaks but not too wide that it chooses incorrect peaks. Save the processing file name in MultiQuant and include details in the name that describe the column used and analytes measured as these are critical method details.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ejd13","text":"Congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) is a group of autosomal recessive disorders that affects adrenal steroidogenesis, resulting in deficiency of the glucocorticoid cortisol and in many cases the mineralocorticoid aldosterone1. This resulting lack of glucocorticoid (and mineralocorticoid) activates the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis causing excessive release of adrenocorticotrophic hormone (ACTH) and  excess adrenal androgen synthesis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":225,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1n42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ada4u","text":"Diagnosing and treating CAH requires reliable methods for steroid analysis. Tandem mass spectrometry methods coupled with chromatographic separation are considered the gold standard analytical technique for steroid analysis2 with the added benefit of enabling simultaneous analysis of multiple steroids.  There are a range of methods that have been developed to measure multiple steroids in CAH3. Here we have developed a liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) method for application to a clinical study that specifically explores the administration of d8-corticosterone as an alternative to hydrocortisone for CAH treatment.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":223,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":394,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1d0vn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bki4p","text":"Plasma samples (200 ÂµL) were enriched with isotopically labelled steroids, diluted with water (0.1% formic acid v/v) and extracted alongside a (0.0025 - 400 ng) calibration curve, by automated 96-well supported liquid extraction (SLE), using dichloromethane and isopropanol as an organic solvent, on a Biotage Extrahera automated sample handler. Extracted steroids were separated on a Shimadzu Nexera uHPLC with gradient elution on a Kinetex C18 column (150 x 3 mm; 2.6 Âµm) and a mobile phase of methanol and water (0.1% formic acid in water and methanol). The run time was 16 minutes, followed by mass spectral analysis on an AB Sciex 6500+ tandem quadrupole mass spectrometer operated in multiple reaction mode, positive ionisation. The method measures five steroids - hydrocortisone (cortisol) and d8-corticosterone - combined with markers of CAH - androgens and the intermediate 17Î±-hydroxyprogesterone, alongside the internal standards - in plasma. Validation demonstrated that this method is sensitive, specific, and reliable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ikr1","text":"All human studies were approved by the University of Edinburgh NHS Lothian ACCORD Ethical Review Board.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1l5ep","text":"Ensure all training is up-to-date for operating the necessary laboratory instrumentation and equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: steroid,steroid analysis,quantitative steroid measurement,LC-MS/MS,corticosterone,testosterone,supported liquid extraction,tandem mass spectrometry,steroid mass spectrometry,17-hydroxyprogesterone,androstenedione,cortisol,congenital adrenal hyperplasia,androstenedione,corticosterone,cortisol,hydrocortisone,17a-hydroxyprogesterone

J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2013 Oct;98(10):3971-3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":142,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":176,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j20i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hi3i","text":"3 - Rakete S, Schubert T, Vogeser M. Semi-automated serum steroid profiling with tandem mass spectrometry. J Mass Spectrom Adv Clin Lab. 2022 27 40-48. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":107,"length":28},{"style":"bold","offset":142,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bpm0o","text":"Prepare 1 mg/mL stock solution of d8-corticosterone (d8B) from powder then prepare separate 100 Âµg/mL stock solutions of each steroid - d8B, cortisol (F), 17a-hydroxyprogesterone (17OHP4), testosterone (T) and androstenedione (A4) in methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"daoqe","text":"Prepare a mixed stock of the 5 steroids - D8B, F, 17OHP4, T, A4 - by using 100 Âµg/mL stock solutions. Do this by adding 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL D8B, 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL F, 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL 17OHP4, 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL T and 50 ÂµL x 100 Âµg/mL A4 + 750 ÂµL methanol to give a 5 Âµg/mL stock. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":263,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l7e4","text":"Dilute the 5 Âµg/mL stock Mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 500 ng/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":100,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"993d6","text":"Dilute the 500 ng/mL mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 500 ng/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 50 ng/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":98,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89qjd","text":"Dilute the 50 ng/mL mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 5 ng/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":95,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fieij","text":"Dilute the 5 ng/mL Mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (100 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL + 900 ÂµL methanol ) to give 500 pg/mL stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l73s","text":"Dilute the 500 pg/mL Mixed STOCK by 1:10 dilution (  x 5 Âµg/mL +  methanol ) to give 50 pg/mL stock   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8pita","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"900","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"71BBA585D29D11EE8AEF0A58A9FEAC02","step_guid":"71BC2882D29D11EE8AEF0A58A9FEAC02","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84dj1","text":"Prepare 100 Âµg/mL solutions of each isotopically labelled internal standard (d4-cortisol, 13C3-testosterone, 13C3-androstenedione and d9-progesterone) in methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":20},{"style":"sup","offset":90,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":109,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":93,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":112,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b25bu","text":"Prepare a mixed 5 Âµg/mL Internal Standard mix stock solution of the three isotopically labelled steroids by adding   x 100 Âµg/mL d4-cortisol,  x 100 Âµg/mL 13C3-testosterone and x 100 Âµg/mL13C3-androstenedione and x 100 Âµg/mL d9-progesterone to  methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":13},{"style":"sup","offset":155,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":188,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":158,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":191,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":115,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":142,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":176,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":212,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":243,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d0eqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"C8334C0FD1D911EEB8BD0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"425","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"edfh1","text":"Prepare a 5 ng/mL Working Internal Standard solution by taking 10 ÂµL x 5 Âµg/mL Int Std Mix + 1990 ÂµL methanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of calibration standard curve and samples
Set up of supported liquid extraction of steroids from calibration standards and samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c2uq4","text":"Label a 2 mL deep well 96-well collection plate (Biotage). Label a Supported Liquid Extraction SLE400 plate with batch details. Label a 2 mL deep well 96-well collection plate (Waters).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6520f","text":"Design and prepare batch of standards and samples in Microsoft Excel template (see Files), following a column-wise plate map design as below (Table S1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0lqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gl1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"doth9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8m6hk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekjli","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d6mam","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":294,"id":448100,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"5ig1m\",\"text\":\"Table S1 - Plate Map - Column-wise plate layout for automated Supported Liquid Extraction on an Extrahera liquid handling robot (Biotage, Sweden)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":21}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxvgbm8pf.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxvebm8pf.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxvfbm8pf.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/pxvdbm8pf.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"akrj6","text":"Using a multi-step pipette enrich the plate containing calibration standards with WIS by adding  x 5 ng/mL Working Internal Standard into each calibration standard, including 0 std and each sample (human plasma), except for the double blank and solvent blank.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":97,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":96,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dnj1a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

Programme Extrahera to aliquot  0.1% formic acid in water (v/v) into each well of the 96-well deep well plate containing the samples and standards. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":215,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ir7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"47avg","text":"Programme the Extrahera to transfer   of liquid from each well (containing sample and the diluent, into a 400 ÂµL volume Supported Liquid Extraction plate (SLE400), pre-placed into the deck on the Extrahera, with a deep well Waters 2 mL deep well collection plate below, pre-labelled with the batch details and date of extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":36,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5f870","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"abccs","text":"Allow the diluted sample to adsorb onto the SLE extraction bed for   before eluting with   x  98:2 (v/v) dichloromethane/isopropanol and repeating twice more, each time collecting the eluent into the collection plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2cge2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qt02","text":"Set up the Shimadzu Nexera X2 liquid chromatography system and fit with a Phenomenex Krud Katcher and a Phenomenex 150 x 3 mm; 2.6 Âµm Kinetex C18 liquid chromatography column, using mobile phase A - water with 0.1% formic acid and mobile phase B - methanol with 0.1% formic acid at 0.5 mL/min and   diverting to the mass spectrometer at 0.2 mins and ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":297,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7j1r2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"40","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Method specific data evaluation of LC-MS/MS data
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fa81o","text":"Use MultiQuant software and Microsoft Excel to evaluate the LC-MS/MS data, by defining calibration standard levels, ensuring accuracy of the calibration standards and linear regression \u003e 0.99. Use the Table above, to calculate the concentration of steroids in each sample, as detailed in the protocol below. Remember to account for the volume of sample extracted and express as ng/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ln9o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ac3u6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":85393,"title":"Using MultiQuant and Excel software to evaluate and report multi-analyte targeted LC-MS/MS data","title_html":"Using MultiQuant and Excel software to evaluate and report multi-analyte targeted LC-MS/MS data","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"using-multiquant-and-excel-software-to-evaluate-an-cxmrxk56","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nhykbm8pf.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nhykbm8pf.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Natalie ZM Homer","affiliation":"University of Edinburgh","affiliation_url":"n.z.m.homer@ed.ac.uk","username":"natalie-zm-homer","link":"","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9z9bm8pf.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9z9bm8pf.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n9z8bm8pf.webp"}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":17},"type_id":1,"guid":"F51A3BEA29AC11EE93FC0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}
